analysis: The documents all pertain to orders granting specific committees or boards access to tax returns (income, excess-profits, declared value excess-profits, capital stock, estate, or gift tax returns) for specific years. The purpose is to aid investigations or reviews conducted by these entities. The orders cite the authority vested in the president by various sections of the Internal Revenue Code or Revenue Acts. The documents span from 1932 to 1973.
title: Tax Return Access for Congressional Oversight
